CONVERSATION GROUP: Good evening to you all! Or is it morning? It's so hard to tell with all these damned... lovely luminescent things keeping you from getting any sleep.
I have an important job I'd ask of you, but first there's the matter of this man here.  He's been badly injured and I can't bear to see him die if there's anything I can do.
But then I felt absolutely terrible afterwards and have been looking over him ever since.
Might you have a potion or some other sort of healing implement to help him?  I simply can't see him suffer like this.
Excellent!  I knew you were the caring sort.  Now lets just give the man a quick swig of this... and I'm sure he'll be all better.
BK this condition check is worrying for "future content"... can't we just test IfClericInParty?
There we are!  Now with any luck I won't be stabbed in my sleep by the murderous b-b-bah!  Please, I can't take much more of this!
This damned helmet! It won't come off! And it keeps compelling me to be... well... you've seen for yourself.
Please, you have to help me get this thing off!  It's driving me insane!
It's some sort of cursed item.  I was told it could be used to trick those into believing I was aligned with good.  But it does far more than that...
I haven't even found the time to research the stone! The whole reason I put this damn thing on!
The Celestial Stone!  It's a powerful artifact, said to let you communicate with the Celestial Plane.  But the monks that guard its temple protect it against anyone who is not pure of heart.
But honestly, who is? Totally unreasonable, to prohibit my study for such ridiculous demands!
I bought this from a dealer in Gracklstugh. It was meant to mask my alignment from them so I could get the stone.
It worked, but now it compels me to do good at every turn! I had to exile myself to the Underdark just to keep myself from simply returning the stone to them out of the goodness of my heart.

It was all to get the Celestial Stone from those damned uptight monks!  It's a powerful artifact, said to let you communicate with the Celestial Plane.  But the monks that guard its temple protect it against anyone who is not pure of heart.
I tried... but I was distracted by the plight of all those poor Derro.  I attempted to free some slaves and was quickly run out of town under threat of death.

Oh, thank you! I can't wait to be free of this dreadful thing! The person you're looking for is duergar doing business out of his house. I'm sure this all was just a funny misunderstanding and he'll be happy to tell you how to remove this.

Oh, I see. Well please... I don't want to rush you as I'm sure you've got very important business. But this mask is slowly eroding at my sense of self and I believe I will soon be nothing more than a hollow shell of good intentions.
Oh... ahh... there you are!  Good news, our Duergar friend woke up!  He promptly walloped me for several... agonizing minutes before walking off cursing at me in some tongue I didn't understand...
But... ugh... I'm just glad he's alright. I'm sure deep down he's grateful. So, how goes the search? Did you find something to pry off this accursed mask?
And I can't even use it! Hahaha, the mask can't fool the real thing... and now I feel nothing but guilt for what I've done.  But it's not my guilt, damn it!  It's the mask's!
BK turning this from persuade to WISDOM
[SUCCESS] Maybe... maybe you're right. I can't lie that it felt good to help others, but I thought it was just the mask's work.  But maybe this is good for me.
Alright, you win. The mask stays on... perhaps I can do something worthwhile with my life.  Maybe someday I'll even be worthy enough for the stone to react to me.
I'm a changed man now!  And I'll do an honest man's work from now on.  Thank you, adventurer.  I'll never forget this.
[FAILURE] Even if that were true, I don't want to change. I am who I am, and I won't let this thing change me!

Here... take this damn stone! It's been nothing but trouble and I can't even use it... that's the only payment you'll get from me. Now get out of my way... I don't want to see you or that stone ever again.
Ah... I can feel its influence slipping away already. It feels so... liberating! Thank you, adventurers. Truly.
It's no longer worth the trouble, and I've got bigger plans now that I'm free.  Oh, and take that stupid mask as well.  I'm sure it's still got some value to it.
I'm off to go take my life back!  The first matter of business is finding that sucker punching Duergar and making sure he doesn't get up from my next spell!

Here, take the stone. Even with the mask it'll never work for me.  And despite everything, I'm compelled by the mask to give it to you.  I guess you're more worthy of it than I.
Oh well.  Take care, adventurers.  We probably won't ever see eachother again.

Fade and show Perren without the mask
Most travelers don't know about me, so I assume you've been pointed in the right direction from one of my valued customers.
We need a way to remove it.
I don't know why he wanted it back, and I don't much care. If you're hoping to get it though, I'd suggest going after him. He's probably just left for the surface now.
BK this link was orphaned. I hooked it up to what seemed logical.
Well you don't have it on you, so I can guess you're here on behalf of that little weasel Perren.  Well you can forget it!  That bastard can stay like that forever!
I hired him on as an enchanter for my shop and he managed to lie and steal his way through almost everything I had.
I knew what he was up to, the stone he was trying to get. When I didn't have anything to help him, he took whatever he could and left.
I devoted the next year or so of my life tracking him down, trying to get him back for what he did.  I came across this mask here and came to learn about its little curse.
I do, and it stays with me.  I'm not going to let him undo this curse.  You'll have to go through my guards and I if you want it.  So what's it going to be?  Will you let me go?
[CHA] If you can't be sold, maybe your guards can. How much is he paying you?
So that's it then. That bastard gets to walk away free while I work on rebuilding my shattered life.  I suppose that's just how the world is, huh?

Yes, if you think you can get away with trying to bribe my guards in front of me you're sorely mistaken.  I won't let you free that man from his fate!  Kill them!
Now come on, we still have a long way to reach the surface. Here's hoping a tough looking band of dretch doesn't scare you off.
